citeinfo.title: Changes in Anthropogenic Influences on Streams and Rivers: Boundary Identification

descript.abstract: This dataset contains the basic identification for the boundaries used in the product: Hydrologic Unit Codes level 10 (HUC-10s), U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) Level IV ecoregions, and U.S. counties.
descript.purpose: These data are intended to provide a framework in which watershed-specific studies of water quality in streams and rivers may be analyzed. The focus of the data is on anthropogenic changes over time.
descript.supplinf: Three comma-separated text files are given here: one each for HUC-10 areas, USEPA Level IV ecoregions, and U.S. counties. There is enough information provided in each table to be able to "scale up" or aggregate data in the other datasets to broader scales, for example to aggregate HUC-10 areas to HUC-8, 6, 4, or 2s, to aggregate level IV (4) ecoregions to levels 3, 2, or 1, or aggregate counties to states. Each text file here contains a "uniqid" field, which is the link to the data in all other datasets in this product. HUC-10 boundaries were obtained on January 9, 2018 from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) National Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) at https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180 (National Resources Conservation Service, 2017). Each table in the product contains 15,458 rows, one for each HUC-10 area. For some data layers, namely Impervousness, Landuse, and Timber, calculations are also given for counties (n = 3,109; National Historic Geographic Information System, 2013), and USEPALevel IV ecoregions (n = 967) (U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, 2013). The processing and setup for each of these boundary datasets is described below under Process Steps. The geospatial processing for the project was based on datasets which all used the following standard projection information: PROJECTION ALBERS, UNITS meters, SPHEROID GRS1980, DATUM NAD83, PARAMETERS, 29 30 0.000, 45 30 0.000, -96 00 0.000, 23 00 0.000, 0.0, 0.0. References: National Historical Geographic Information System, 2013, U.S. geographic summary data and boundary files, 2010: National Historical Geographic Information System, Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS), county boundaries, accessed February 1, 2013 at: https://www.nhgis.org/. National Resources Conservation Service, 2017, Watershed boundary dataset (WBD): National Resources Conservation Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, available at https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/main/national/technical/nra/geo/, accessed January 9, 2018 from https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, 2013, Level IV ecoregions of the conterminous United States: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development â€“ National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory, accessed November 17, 2017 at: https://www.epa.gov/eco-research/level-iii-and-iv-ecoregions-continental-united-states.

srcinfo.srccontr: HUC-10 boundaries used in data calculations.
County boundaries used in data calculations.

citeinfo.title: Level III and IV ecoregions of the continental United States

srcinfo.srccontr: Level IV ecoregion boundaries used in data calculations.

procstep.procdesc: (1) 2010 county boundaries in polygon format were downloaded from the National Historical Geographic Information System at https://www.nhgis.org/. Boundaries were subset to the conterminous U.S. A unique identifer for GIS processing was added and the area for each county in square kilometers was calculated from the polygons. The polygons were then converted to a 100-meter grid. There are 3,109 resultant county areas.

(2) USEPA Level IV ecoregion boundaries in polygon format were downloaded from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at https://www.epa.gov/eco-research/level-iii-and-iv-ecoregions-continental-united-states. A unique identifier for GIS processing was added and the area in square kilometers was calculated from the polygons. The polygons were then converted to a 100-meter grid. There are 967 resultant level IV ecoregion areas.

(3) HUC-10 boundaries in polygon format were downloaded from the National Resources Conservation Service at https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/huc/folder/39640323180. Boundaries were subset to those covering the conterminous U.S. Because, unlike the county and ecoregion boundaries, some HUC-10 boundaries extend considerably into areas outside the land area of CONUS (for example into Canada, Mexico, and oceans), and the vast majority of data layers to be processed were limited to only the land area of CONUS, the HUC-10 boundaries were clipped against the level IV ecoregion boundaries above. A number of "sliver" polygons which resulted from this were deleted. A unique identifier for GIS processing was added and the area in square kilometers was calculated from the polygons. The polygons were then converted to a 100-meter grid. There are 15,458 resultant HUC-10 areas.

enttyp.enttypl: Attribute Table for boundary identification data for Counties, LEvel IV ecoregions, and HUC-10 areas
enttyp.enttypds: Surface Water Staus and Trends project, USGS National Water Quality Program

attr.attrdefs: Unique integer ID used for internal processing and for linking data from other tables for county data

attr.attrdef: COunty id from source boundary dataset, consisting of two-digit code for state (first two digits), and three-digit code for county (last three digits). Based on the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) State and County codes.
County name from source boundary dataset
County area in square kilometers (field added and calculated from polygon dataset during GIS processing)
Unique identification number for Eco-IV areas
attr.attrdefs: Unique integer ID used for internal processing and for linking data from other tables for Eco-IV data

attrdomv.udom: Unique identifier for level IV ecoregion area.

attr.attrdef: Level IV id from source boundary dataset
Level IV name from source boundary dataset
Level III code from source boundary dataset. This allows scaling up to broader regions.

attrdomv.udom: North American level 3 code. Levels 2, and 1 may be identified from this.

attr.attrdef: Ecoregion IV area in square kilometers (field added and calculated from polygon dataset during GIS processing)

attr.attrdefs: Unique integer ID used for internal processing and for linking data from other tables for HUC-10 data

attr.attrdef: HUC-10 id from source boundary dataset, a 10-digit identifier

attrdomv.udom: HUC-10 id. Levels 8, 6, 4, and 2 can be aggregated from this.

attr.attrdef: HUC-10 name from source boundary dataset
HUC-10 area in square kilometers (field added and calculated from polygon dataset during GIS processing)
